CIRCULAR _No, AS 20 /2006

Subject: “Measures to_be taken to minimize the number of

failures regarding detection of dummy IED(s)”,

It has been seen from the reports received from various ASGs/BCAS.

,_ that CISF personnel are not able to detect the dummy checks carried out

by BCAS/CIW staff when the dummy is an Improvised Explosive Device
(IED). Infact, the percentage of failure in detecting the dummy IEDs is on
the rise. More often than not, CISF screeners/friskers failed to detect the
IED(s) being carried as dummy/decoy check by BCAS officials which is a
matter of concern. In order. to minimize these failures/lapses on the part of
CISF personnel, following is suggested:-

Screeners should be familiarized with the images of dummy IEDs
placed in different orientation/shapes/sizes so that they would
have a clear idea of the different kind/shape/size of IED(s). For this
dummy JEDs can be prepared with the help of local
police/BCAS/Army etc.

. From the TIPS projections and other material available, CASOs

should inform the screeners as to the likely images which can turn
out to be an IED, Screeners should be told about the likely shapes
taken by detonators, wires, timing devices on the x-ray screen.

| CASO should procure photographs of IEDs to familiarize the

screeners regarding different types/shapes/sizes of IEDs.

. Efforts should be made for coordination between the hand

baggage, frisker and the screener in order to identify
disassembled IEDs. Screener/frisker should be familiarized with
the different components of IEDs (disassembled IEDs).

v. There should be proper.coordination/eye contact/voice contact

between the screener and physical searcher so as to make
clear exactly what suspicious items to be looked for while
physical checking the hand baggage.

vi. Only well-trained and proficient screeners should be deployed

for screeners/frisking duties, particularly during peak hours.

vii. They should be specifically advised not to be in any extra hurry

to clear the baggage. Even in case of a bit of doubt/suspicion,
the screener should direct for thorough hand check of the
baggage.

viii... CASO concerned: should take personal interest in this regard for

improving the efficiency of all CISF screeners. The lean period
should also be utilized for job training in order to enhance the
efficiency of the screeners/frisker.

Please acknowledge the receipt and ensure strict compliance.
